component.name: component

help: Name of a method. For a web service, the name of an operation.
method.name: method

help: Name of a variable for the invocation result.
returnvariable.name: returnvariable

help: Name of a structure; associative array of arguments to pass to the method.
argumentcollection.name: argumentcollection

help: Overrides username specified in Administrator > Web Services
username.name: username

help: Overrides passowrd specified in Administrator > Web Services
password.name: password

help: The URL of the WSDL file for the web service.
webservice.name: webservice

help: The timeout for the web service request, in seconds
timeout.name: timeout

help: The proxy server required to access the webservice URL.
proxyserver.name: proxyserver

help: The port to use on The proxy server.
proxyport.name: proxyport

help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.
proxyuser.name: proxyuser

help: The user's password on the proxy server.
proxypassword.name: proxypassword

help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element. Specify this attribute if the web service contains multiple ports. Default: first port found in the WSDL.
serviceport.name: serviceport

help: *  yes: reload the WSDL file and regenerate the artifacts used to consume the web service * no
refreshwsdl.name: refreshwsdl

help: A string that contains a space-delimited list of arguments to pass to the WSDL2Java tool that generates Java stubs for the web services.
wsdl2javaargs.name: wsdl2javaargs

help: Specifies the version of Axis to be used. If it is "1" then axis 1 will be used and if it is "2" then Axis 2 will be used
wsversion.name: wsversion

cfinvoke.name: cfinvoke

cfinvokeargument.help: Passes the name and value of a parameter to a component method or a web service. This tag is used within the cfinvoke tag.

help: Argument name
name.name: name

help: Argument value
value.name: value

help: Enables you to omit a parameter when invoking a web service. It is an error to specify omit="true" if the cfinvoke webservice attribute is not specified. - true: omit this parameter when invoking a web service. - false: do not omit this parameter when invoking a web service.
omit.name: omit

cfinvokeargument.name: cfinvokeargument

cflayout.help: Creates a region of its container (such as the browser window or a cflayoutarea tag) with a specific layout behavior: a bordered area, a horizontal or vertically arranged box, or a tabbed navigator.

help: The type of layout.
type.name: type

help: Specifies the default alignment of the content of child layout areas. Each cflayoutarea tag can specify an alignment attribute to override this value.
align.name: align

help: The name of the layout region.  Must be unique on a page.
name.name: name

help: Applies only to hbox and vbox layouts. You can use any valid CSS length or percent format, such as 10, 10% 10px, or 10em, for this attribute. The padding is included in the child layout area and takes the style of the layout area.
padding.name: padding

help: A CSS style specification that defines layout styles.
style.name: style

help: A CSS style specification that defines layout stApplies only to tab type layouts. Specifies the height of the content area of all child layout areas. You can override this setting by specifying a hight setting in a individual cflayoutarea tag style attributes.
tabheight.name: tabheight

help: Applies only to tab type layouts. Specifies the location of the tabs relative to the tab region contents.
tabposition.name: tabposition

help: Specify whether title bar should act as collapse/expand toggle or not; default=true.
titlecollapse.name: titlecollapse

help: Specify whether active tab needs to be on top always; default=false.
activeontop.name: activeontop

help: True to adjust the active item's height to fill the available space in the container; default=true.
fillheight.name: fillheight

help: A Boolean value that specifies whether the border layout should occupy 100% of the width and height of the window
fitToWindow.name: fitToWindow

height._: Height of the layout in pixels.
height.name: height

width._: Width of the layout in pixels.
width.name: width

help: If true, a background tab strip is displayed
tabstrip.name: tabstrip

cflayout.name: cflayout

cflayoutarea.help: Defines a region within a cflayout tag body, such as an individual tab of a tabbed layout. This tag is not used in Flash forms.

help: The position...(docs don't explain this one).
position.name: position

help: Specifies how to align child controls within the layout area.
align.name: align

help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area can close. Specifying this attribute adds an x icon on the tab or title bar that a user can click to close the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.
closable.name: closable

help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area can collapse. Specifying this attribute adds a >> or << icon on the title bar that a user can click to collapse the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.
collapsible.name: collapsible

help: A Boolean value specifying whether the tab is disabled, that is, whether user can select the tab to display its contents. Disabled tabs are greyed out. Ignored if the selected attribute value is true.
disabled.name: disabled

help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area is initially collapsed. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center. Ignored if the collapsible attribute value is false.
initCollapsed.name: initCollapsed

help: A Boolean value specifying whether the area is initially hidden. To show an initially hidden area, use the ColdFusion.Layout.showArea or ColdFusion.Layout.showTab function. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.
initHide.name: initHide

help: For layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the maximum height of the area, in pixels, that you can set by dragging a splitter. For layouts with left or right position attributes, the maximum width of the area. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.
maxSize.name: maxSize

help: For layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the minimum height of the area, in pixels, that you can set by dragging a splitter. For layouts with left or right position attributes, the minimum width of the area., You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.
minSize.name: minSize

help: The name of the layout area.
name.name: name

help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandlerfunction ), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.
onBindError.name: onBindError

help: Specifies how to display child content whose size would cause the control to overflow the window boundaries.  ? In Internet Explorer, layout areas with the visible setting expand to fit the size of the contents, rather than having the contents extend beyond the layout area.
overflow.name: overflow

help: A Boolean value specifying whether this tab is initially selected so that its contents appears in the layout.
selected.name: selected

help: For hbox layouts and border layouts with top or bottom position attributes, the initial height of the area. For vbox layouts and border layouts with left or right position attributes, the initial width of the area. For hbox and vbox layouts, you can use any valid CSS length or percent format (such as 10, 10% 10px, or 10em) for this attribute. For border layouts, this attribute value must be an integer number of pixels. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center. ColdFusion automatically determines the center size based on the size of all other layout areas.
size.name: size

help: A URL that returns the layout area contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. You can use a bind expression with dependencies in this attribute. If file specified in this attribute includes tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfpod, you must use the cfajaximport tag on the page that includes the cflayoutarea tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.
source.name: source

help: A Boolean value specifying whether the layout area has a divider between it and the adjacent layoutarea control. Users can drag the splitter to change the relative sizes of the areas. If this attribute is set true on a left or right position layout area, the splitter resizes the area and its adjacent area horizontally. If this attribute is set true on a top or bottom position layout area, the splitter resizes the layout vertically. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center
splitter.name: splitter

help: A CSS style specification that controls the appearance of the area.
style.name: style

help: For tab layouts, the text to display on the tab. For border layouts, if you specify this attribute ColdFusion creates a title bar for the layout area with the specified text as the title. By default, these layouts do not have a title bar if they are not closable or collapsible. You cannot use this attribute for border layout areas with a position attribute value of center.
title.name: title

help: *  true: Refresh the contents of the tab by running the source bind expression whenever the tab display region shows (for example, when the user selects the tab), in addition to when bind events occur. * false: Refresh the tab display region only when the bind expression is triggered by its bind event.
refreshonactivate.name: refreshonactivate

help: Specifies the location of the icon to display with the title.
titleIcon.name: titleIcon

help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.
bindOnLoad.name: bindOnLoad

help: If true, a tab tip is displayed
tabtip.name: tabtip

cflayoutarea.name: cflayoutarea

cfldap.help: Provides an interface to a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) directory server, such as the Netscape Directory Server.

help: Host name or IP address of LDAP server.
server.name: server

help: Port of the LDAP server (default 389).
port.name: port

help: The User ID. Required if secure = "CFSSL_BASIC"
username.name: username

help: Password that corresponds to user name. If secure = "CFSSL_BASIC", V2 encrypts the password before transmission.
password.name: password

help: * query: returns LDAP entry information only. Requires name, start, and attributes attributes. * add: adds LDAP entries to LDAP server. Requires attributes attribute. * modify: modifies LDAP entries, except distinguished name dn attribute, on LDAP server. Requires dn. See modifyType attribute. * modifyDN: modifies distinguished name attribute for LDAP entries on LDAP server. Requires dn. * delete: deletes LDAP entries on an LDAP server. Requires dn.
action.name: action

help: Required if action = "Query" Name of LDAP query. The tag validates the value.
name.name: name

help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Default 60000
timeout.name: timeout

help: Maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.
maxrows.name: maxrows

help: Required if action = "Query" Distinguished name of entry to be used to start a search.
start.name: start

help: Scope of search, from entry specified in start attribute for action = "Query". * oneLevel: entries one level below entry. * base: only the entry. * subtree: entry and all levels below it.
scope.name: scope

help: Required if action = "Query", "Add", "ModifyDN", or "Modify" For queries: comma-delimited list of attributes to return. For queries, to get all attributes, specify "*".  If action = "add" or "modify", you can specify a list of update columns. Separate attributes with a semicolon.  If action = "ModifyDN", CFML passes attributes to the LDAP server without syntax checking.
attributes.name: attributes

help: A comma-delimited list of columns that are to be returned as binary values.
returnasbinary.name: returnasbinary

help: Search criteria for action = "Query". List attributes in the form: "(attribute operator value)" Example: "(sn = Smith)"
filter.name: filter

help: Attribute(s) by which to sort query results. Use a comma delimiter.
sort.name: sort

help: Default asc * nocase: case-insensitive sort * asc: ascending (a to z) case-sensitive sort * desc: descending (z to a) case-sensitive sort  You can enter a combination of sort types; for example, sortControl = "nocase, asc".
sortcontrol.name: sortcontrol

help: Distinguished name, for update action. Example: "cn = Bob Jensen, o = Ace Industry, c = US"
dn.name: dn

help: Used with action = "query". First row of LDAP query to insert into a CFML query.
startrow.name: startrow

help: Default replace  How to process an attribute in a multi-value list. * add: appends it to any attributes * delete: deletes it from the set of attributes * replace: replaces it with specified attributes  You cannot add an attribute that is already present or that is empty.
modifytype.name: modifytype

help: * Yes: attempt to rebind referral callback and reissue query by referred address using original credentials. * No: referred connections are anonymous
rebind.name: rebind

help: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.
referral.name: referral

help: Security to employ, and required information. One option: * CFSSL_BASIC  "CFSSL_BASIC" provides V2 SSL encryption and server authentication.
secure.name: secure

help: Default , (a comma) Delimiter to separate attribute values of multi-value attributes. Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.  For example, if $ (dollar sign), the attributes attribute could be "objectclass = top$person", where the first value of objectclass is top, and the second value is person. This avoids confusion if values include commas.
separator.name: separator

help: Separator between attribute name-value pairs. Use this attribute if:  * the attributes attribute specifies more than one item, or * an attribute contains the default delimiter (semicolon). For example: mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en  Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.  For example, if $ (dollar sign), you could specify "cn = Double Tree Inn$street = 1111 Elm; Suite 100 where the semicolon is part of the street value.
delimiter.name: delimiter

help: Password for certificate
clientcertpassword.name: clientcertpassword

help: If STARTTLS command should be sent
usetls.name: usetls

help: Path to certificate
clientcert.name: clientcert

cfldap.name: cfldap

cflocation.help: Stops execution of the current page and opens a CFML page or HTML file.

help: URL of HTML file or CFML page to open.
url.name: url

help: If url parameters need to be added to url or not
addtoken.name: addtoken

help: The HTTP status code
statuscode.name: statuscode

cflocation.name: cflocation

cflock.help: Ensures the integrity of shared data. Instantiates the following kinds of locks:  * Exclusive allows single-thread access to the CFML constructs * Read-only allows multiple requests to access CFML constructs

help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait to obtain a lock. If lock is obtained, tag execution continues. Otherwise, behavior depends on throwOnTimeout attribute value.
timeout.name: timeout

help: Lock scope. Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. Lock name. Only one request in the specified scope can execute the code within this tag (or within any other cflock tag with the same lock scope scope) at a time.
scope.name: scope

help: Lock name. Mutually exclusive with the scope attribute. Only one request can execute the code within a cflock tag with a given name at a time. Cannot be an empty string.
name.name: name

help: How timeout conditions are handled.
throwontimeout.name: throwontimeout

help: readOnly: lets more than one request read shared data. exclusive: lets one request read or write shared data.
type.name: type

cflock.name: cflock

cflog.help: Writes a message to a log file.

help: Message text to log.
text.name: text

help: If you omit the file attribute, writes messages to standard log file. Ignored, if you specify file attribute.  Application: writes to Application.log, normally used for application-specific messages. Scheduler: writes to Scheduler.log, normally used to log the execution of scheduled tasks.
log.name: log

help: Message file. Specify only the main part of the filename. For example, to log to the Testing.log file, specify "Testing".  The file must be located in the default log directory. You cannot specify a directory path. If the file does not exist, it is created automatically, with the suffix .log.
file.name: file

help: Type (severity) of the message
type.name: type

help: Log application name, if it is specified in a cfapplication tag.
application.name: application

cflog.name: cflog

cflogin.help: A container for user login and authentication code. CFML runs the code in this tag if a user is not already logged in. You put code in the tag that authenticates the user and identifies the user with a set of roles. Used with cfloginuser tag.

help: Time interval with no keyboard activity after which CFML logs the user off. Seconds.
idletimeout.name: idletimeout

help: Unique application identifier. Limits the login validity to one application, as specified by the cfapplication tag.
applicationtoken.name: applicationtoken

help: Domain of the cookie that is used to mark a user as logged in. Use this attribute to enable a user login cookie to work with multiple clustered servers in the same domain.
cookiedomain.name: cookiedomain

help: If concurrent login sessions should be allowed.
allowconcurrent.name: allowconcurrent

help: If basic authentication should be used to validate login.
usebasicauth.name: usebasicauth

cflogin.name: cflogin

cfloginuser.help: Identifies an authenticated user to CFML. Specifies the user ID and roles. Used within a cflogin tag.

help: A username.
name.name: name

help: A user password.
password.name: password

help: A comma-delimited list of role identifiers.  CFML processes spaces in a list element as part of the element.
roles.name: roles

cfloginuser.name: cfloginuser

cflogout.help: Logs the current user out. Removes knowledge of the user ID, password, and roles from the server. If you do not use this tag, the user is automatically logged out when the session ends.

help: When invoked who all should be logged out.
session.name: session

cflogout.name: cflogout

cfloop.help: Different items are required based on loop type. Items listed as required may not be depending on your loop type. Loop forms: [query] [condition] [index + from + to ] [index + list] [collection + item ]

help: Index value. CFML sets it to from value and increments or decrements by step value, until it equals to value.
index.name: index

help: Beginning value of index.
to.name: to

help: Ending value of index.
from.name: from

help: Ending value of index.
step.name: step

help: Condition that controls the loop.
condition.name: condition

help: Query that controls the loop.
query.name: query

help: First row of query that is included in the loop.
startrow.name: startrow

help: Last row of query that is included in the loop.
endrow.name: endrow

help: A list, variable, or filename; contains a list
list.name: list

help: Character(s) that separates items in list
delimiters.name: delimiters

help: The collection attribute is used with the item attribute. often to loop over a structure
collection.name: collection

help: The item attribute is used with the collection attribute. often to loop over a structure
item.name: item

help: An array.
array.name: array

help: The number of characters to read during each iteration of the loop from the file specified in the file attribute. If the value of the characters attribute is more than the number of characters in the file, ColdFusion uses the number of characters in the file.
characters.name: characters

help: The absolute path and filename of the text file to read, one line at a time. This is helpful when reading large text files, because you can reuse the value of the index variable, which contains the current line of the file. When the loop completes, ColdFusion closes the file.
file.name: file

help: Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "Customer_ID."
group.name: group

help: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.
groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive

cfloop.name: cfloop

cfmail.help: Sends an e-mail message that optionally contains query output, using an SMTP server.

help: Message recipient e-mail addresses.
to.name: to

help: E-mail message sender:
from.name: from

help: Address(es) to which to copy the message
cc.name: cc

help: Address(es) to which to copy the message, without listing them in the message header.
bcc.name: bcc

help: Message subject. Can be dynamically generated.
subject.name: subject

help: Address(es) to which the recipient is directed to send replies.
replyto.name: replyto

help: Address to which mailing systems should send delivery failure notifications. Sets the mail envelope reverse-path value.
failto.name: failto

help: A user name to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a password attribute
username.name: username

help: A password to send to SMTP servers that require authentication. Requires a username attribute.
password.name: password

help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.
wraptext.name: wraptext

help: The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
charset.name: charset

help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type
type.name: type

help: Path of file to attach to message. Attached file is MIME-encoded. CFML attempts to determine the MIME type of the file; use the cfmailparam tag to send an attachement and specify the MIME type.
mimeattach.name: mimeattach

help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for message(s). Use this attribute to send more than one message, or to send query results within a message.
query.name: query

help: Query column to use when you group sets of records to send as a message. For example, to send a set of billing statements to a customer, group on "Customer_ID." Case-sensitive. Eliminates adjacent duplicates when data is sorted by the specified field.
group.name: group

help: Whether to consider case when using the group attribute. To group on case-sensitive records, set this attribute to Yes.
groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive

help: Row in a query to start from.
startrow.name: startrow

help: Maximum number of messages to send when looping over a query.
maxrows.name: maxrows

help: SMTP server address, or (Enterprise edition only) a comma-delimited list of server addresses, to use for sending messages. At least one server must be specified here or in the CFML MX Administrator. A value here overrides the Administrator. A value that includes a port specification overrides the port attribute. See the Usage section for details.
server.name: server

help: TCP/IP port on which SMTP server listens for requests (normally 25). A value here overrides the Administrator.
port.name: port

help: Mailer ID to be passed in X-Mailer SMTP header, which identifies the mailer application.
mailerid.name: mailerid

help: Number of seconds to wait before timing out connection to SMTP server. A value here overrides the Administrator.
timeout.name: timeout

help: Specifies whether to spool mail or always send it Immediately. Overrides the CFML MX Administrator Spool mail messages to disk for delivery setting.
spoolenable.name: spoolenable

help: * Yes: sends debugging output to standard output. By default, if the console window is unavailable, ColdFusion sends output to cf_root\runtime\logs\coldfusion-out.log on server configurations. On J2EE configurations, with JRun, the default location is jrun_home/logs/servername-out.log. * No: does not generate debugging output.
debug.name: debug

help: The message priority level. Can be one of the following values: * An integer in the range 1-5; 1 represents the highest priority. * One of the following string values, which correspond to the numeric values: highest or urgent, high, normal, low, and lowest or non-urgent.
priority.name: priority

help: Whether to use Secure Sockets Layer.
usessl.name: usessl

help: Whether to use Transport Level Security.
usetls.name: usetls

help: Tells ColdFusion to remove any attachments after successful mail delivery.
remove.name: remove

help: Keystore containing the private key and certificate. The supported type is JKS (java key store) and pkcs12
keystore.name: keystore

help: Password with which the private key is stored. If it is not specified, keystorepassword will be used as keypassword as well.
keypassword.name: keypassword

help: Mail will be signed when set to true
sign.name: sign

help: Alias of the key with which the certificate and private key is stored in keystore. If it is not specified then the first entry in the keystore will be picked up.
keyalias.name: keyalias

help: Password of the keystore
keystorepassword.name: keystorepassword

help: If email should be encrypted or not.
encrypt.name: encrypt

help: Path to public key certificate of recipient.
recipientCert.name: recipientCert

help: Encryption algorithm to use.
encryptionAlgorithm.name: encryptionAlgorithm

cfmail.name: cfmail

cfmailparam.help: Attaches a file or adds a header to an e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailparam tag within a cfmail tag.

help: Attaches file to a message. Mutually exclusive with name attribute. The file is MIME encoded before sending.
file.name: file

help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type
type.name: type

help: Name of header. Case-insensitive. Mutually exclusive with file attribute. The values listed are from rfc2822
name.name: name

help: Value of the header.
value.name: value

help: The Identifier for the attached file. This ID should be globally unique and is used to identify the file in an IMG or other tag in the mail body that references the file content.
contentID.name: contentID

help: How the attached file is to be handled. Can be one of the following: - attachment: present the file as an attachment - inline: display the file contents in the message
disposition.name: disposition

help: Lets you send the contents of a ColdFusion variable as an attachment
content.name: content

help: Tells ColdFusion to remove any attachments after successful mail delivery.
remove.name: remove

cfmailparam.name: cfmailparam

cfmailpart.help: Specifies one part of a multipart e-mail message. Can only be used in the cfmail tag. You can use more than one cfmailpart tag within a cfmail tag.

help: The MIME media type of the part. Can be a can be valid MIME media type
type.name: type

help: Specifies the maximum line length, in characters of the mail text. If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.
wraptext.name: wraptext

help: The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
charset.name: charset

cfmailpart.name: cfmailpart

cfmodule.help: Invokes a custom tag for use in CFML application pages. This tag processes custom tag name conflicts.

help: Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. A path to the page that implements the tag.  Relative path: expanded from the current page Absolute path: expanded using CFML mapping A physical path is not valid.
template.name: template

help: Mutually exclusive with the template attribute. A custom tag name, in the form "Name.Name.Name..." Identifies subdirectory, under the CFML tag root directory, that contains custom tag page. For example (Windows format):  <cfmodule name = "superduper.Forums40.GetUserOptions">  This identifies the page GetUserOptions.cfm in the directory CustomTags\superduper\Forums40 under the CFML root directory.
name.name: name

help: A collection of key-value pairs that represent attribute names and values. You can specify multiple key-value pairs. You can specify this attribute only once.
attributecollection.name: attributecollection

cfmodule.name: cfmodule

cfntauthenticate.help: Authenticates a user name and password against the NT domain on which ColdFusion server is running, and optionally retrieves the user's groups.

help: User's login name.
username.name: username

help: User's login name.
password.name: password

help: Domain against which to authenticate the user. The ColdFusion J2EE server must be running on this domain.
domain.name: domain

help: Name of the variable in which to return the results. Default: cfntauthenticate
result.name: result

help: Boolean value specifying whether to Include a comma-delimited list of the user's groups in the result structure. Default: false
listgroups.name: listgroups

help: Boolean value specifying whether to throw an exception if the validation fails. If this attribute is true, ColdFusion throws an error if the user name or password is invalid; the application must handle such errors in a try/catch block or ColdFusion error handler page. Default: false
throwonerror.name: throwonerror

cfntauthenticate.name: cfntauthenticate

cfobject.help: Creates a CFML object, of a specified type.  The tag syntax depends on the object type. Some types use the type attribute; others do not.

help: The object type. You can omit this attribute or specify component. ColdFusion automatically sets the type to component.
type.name: type

help: *  create: instantiates a COM object (typically, a DLL) before invoking methods or properties. * connect: ionnects to a COM object (typically, an EXE) running on server.
action.name: action

help: Component ProgID for the object to invoke. When using Java stubs to connect to the COM object, the class must be the ProgID of the COM object.
class.name: class

help: Name for the instantiated component.
name.name: name

help: *  inproc * local * remote  In Windows, if not specified, uses Registry setting.
context.name: context

help: Server name, using Universal Naming Convention (UNC) or Domain Name Serve (DNS) convention, in one of these forms:  * \\lanserver * lanserver * http://www.servername.com * www.servername.com * 127.0.0.1
server.name: server

help: Name of component to instantiate.
component.name: component

help: Sets arguments for a call to init_orb. Use this attribute only for VisiBroker ORBs. It is available on C++, Version 3.2. The value must be in the form: locale = " -ORBagentAddr 199.99.129.33 -ORBagentPort 19000"  Each type-value pair must start with a hyphen.
locale.name: locale

help: One of the following:  * The absolute URL of the web service. * The name (string) assigned in the ColdFusion Administrator to the web service.
webservice.name: webservice

help: The password to use to access the web service. If the webservice attribute specifies a web service name configured in the ColdFusion Administrator, overrides any password specified in the Administrator entry.
password.name: password

help: Whether to secure communications with the .NET-side agent. If true, ColdFusion uses SSL to communicate with .NET.
secure.name: secure

help: Protocol to use to use for communication between ColdFusion and .NET. Must be one of the following values: * http: Use HTTP/SOAP communication protocol. This option is slower than tcp, but might be required for access through a firewall. * tcp: Use binary TCP/IP protocol. This method is more efficient than HTTP.
protocol.name: protocol

help: The proxy server required to access the web service URL.
proxyserver.name: proxyserver

help: *  yes: reloads the WSDL file and regenerates the artifacts used to consume the web service * no
refreshwsdl.name: refreshwsdl

help: The port name for the web service. This value is case-sensitive and corresponds to the port element's name attribute under the service element.
wsportname.name: wsportname

help: A string that contains a space-delimited list of arguments to pass to the WSDL2Java tool that generates Java stubs for the web services.
wsdl2javaargs.name: wsdl2javaargs

help: The port to use on the proxy server.
proxyport.name: proxyport

help: Port number at which the .NET-side agent is listening.
port.name: port

help: The user's password on the proxy server.
proxypassword.name: proxypassword

help: For local .NET assemblies, the absolute path or paths to the assembly or assemblies (EXE or DLL files) from which to access the .NET class and its supporting classes. For remote .NET assemblies, you must specify the absolute path or paths of the local proxy JAR file or files that represent the assemblies.
assembly.name: assembly

help: The user name to use to access the web service. If the webservice attribute specifies a web service configured name in the ColdFusion Administrator, overrides any user name specified in the Administrator entry.
username.name: username

help: The user ID to send to the proxy server.
proxyuser.name: proxyuser

help: Axis version to be used for generating WebSerive stubs
wsversion.name: wsversion

cfobject.name: cfobject

help: clear: Clears queries from the cache in the Application scope
action.name: action

cfoutput.help: Displays output that can contain the results of processing CFML variables and functions. Can loop over the results of a database query.

help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for output section.
query.name: query

help: Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "Customer_ID."
group.name: group

help: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.
groupcasesensitive.name: groupcasesensitive

help: Row from which to start output.
startrow.name: startrow

help: Maximum number of rows to display.
maxrows.name: maxrows

cfoutput.name: cfoutput

cfparam.help: Tests for a parameter's existence, tests its data type, and, if a default value is not assigned, optionally provides one.

help: Name of parameter to test (such as "client.email" or "cookie.backgroundColor"). If omitted, and if the parameter does not exist, an error is thrown.
name.name: name

help._: The valid format for the data; one of the following.

li: any: any type of value.
array: an array of values.
binary: a binary value.
boolean: a Boolean value: yes, no, true, false, or a number.
creditcard: a 13-16 digit number conforming to the mod10 algorithm.
date or time: a date-time value.
email: a valid e-mail address.
eurodate: a date-time value. Any date part must be in theformat dd/mm/yy, The format can use /, -, or . characters as delimiters.
float or numeric: a numeric value.
guid: a Universally Unique Identifier of the form "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" where 'X' is a hexadecimal number.
numeric: a numeric value
integer: an integer.
query: a query object.
range: a numeric range, specified by the min and max attributes.
regex or regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.
ssn or social_security_number: a U.S. social security number.
string: a string value or single character.
struct: a structure.
telephone: a standard U.S. telephone number.
URL: an http, https, ftp, file, mailto, or news URL.
UUID: a ColdFusion Universally Unique Identifier, formatted 'XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', where 'X' is a hexadecimal number. See CreateUUID.
USdate: a U.S. date of the format mm/dd/yy, with 1-2 digit days and months, 1-4 digit years.
variableName: a string formatted according to ColdFusion variable naming conventions.
xml: XML objects and XML strings.
zipcode: U.S., 5- or 9-digit format ZIP codes.

help: Value to set parameter to if it does not exist. Any expression used for the default attribute is evaluated, even if the parameter exists. The result is not assigned if the parameter exists, but if the expression has side effects, they still occur.
default.name: default

help: The maximum valid value; used only for range validation.
max.name: max

help: The minimum valid value; used only for range validation.
min.name: min

help: A regular experession that the parameter must match; used only for regex or regular_expression validation.
pattern.name: pattern

help: Maximum length of value. Valid for String, email and url types
maxlength.name: maxlength

cfparam.name: cfparam

cfpod.help: Creates a pod, an area of the browser window or layout area with an optional title bar and body that contains display elements.

help: A CSS style specification for the pod body. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.
bodyStyle.name: bodyStyle

help: A CSS style specification for the pod header. As a general rule, use this attribute to set color and font styles. Using this attribute to set the height and width, for example, can result in distorted output.
headerStyle.name: headerStyle

help: Height if the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels.  Default is 100.
height.name: height

help: Name of the pod control.
name.name: name

help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message. If you omit this attribute, and have specified a global error handler (by using the ColdFusion.setGlobalErrorHandler function), it displays the error message; otherwise a default error pop-up displays.
onBindError.name: onBindError

help: Specifies how to display child content whose size would cause the control to overflow the pod boundaries.  Note: In Internet Explorer, pods with the visible setting expand to fit the size of the contents, rather than having the contents extend beyond the layout area.
overflow.name: overflow

help: A URL that returns the pod contents. ColdFusion uses standard page path resolution rules. If you specify this attribute and the cfpod tag has a body, ColdFusion ignores the body contents. You can use a a bind expression with dependencies in this attribute; for more information see the Usage section. Note: If a CFML page specified in this attribute contains tags that use AJAX features, such as cfform, cfgrid, and cfwindow, you must use a cfajaximport tag on the page with the cfpod tag. For more information, see cfajaximport.
source.name: source

help: Text to display in the pod?s title bar. You can use HTML mark up to control the title appearance, of example to show the text in red italic font. If you omit this attribute, the pod does not have a title bar.
title.name: title

help: Width if the control, including the title bar and borders, in pixels. Default is 500.
width.name: width

cfpod.name: cfpod

cfpop.help: Retrieves or deletes e-mail messages from a POP mail server.

help: POP server identifier: A host name; for example, "biff.upperlip.com" An IP address; for example, "192.1.2.225"
server.name: server

help: POP port
port.name: port

help: Overrides username.
username.name: username

help: Overrides password
password.name: password

help: getHeaderOnly: returns message header information only getAll: returns message header information, message text, and attachments if attachmentPath is specified delete: deletes messages on POP server
action.name: action

help: Name for query object that contains the retrieved message information.
name.name: name

help: Message number or comma-delimited list of message numbers to get or delete. Invalid message numbers are ignored. Ignored if uid is specified.
messagenumber.name: messagenumber

help: UID or a comma-delimited list of UIDs to get or delete. Invalid UIDs are ignored.
uid.name: uid

help: If action="getAll", specifies a directory in which to save any attachments. If the directory does not exist, CFML creates it.  If you omit this attribute, CFML does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.
attachmentpath.name: attachmentpath

help: Maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing
timeout.name: timeout

help: Number of messages to return or delete, starting with the number in startRow. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.
maxrows.name: maxrows

help: First row number to get or delete. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.
startrow.name: startrow

help: Yes: Generate unique filenames for files attached to an e-mail message, to avoid naming conflicts when files are saved
generateUniqueFileNames.name: generateUniqueFileNames

help: If true, uses POP3S
secure.name: secure

cfpop.name: cfpop

cfprocessingdirective.help: Provides the following insformation to CFML on how to process the current page:  * Specifies whether to remove excess whitespace character from CFML generated content in the tag body. * Identifies the character encoding (character set) of the page contents.

help: Boolean; whether to suppress white space characters within the cfprocessingdirective block that are generated by CFML tags and often do not affect HTML appearance. Does not affect any white space in HTML code.
suppressWhitespace.name: suppressWhitespace

help: A string literal; cannot be a variable. Identifies the character encoding of the current CFML page. This attribute affects the entire page, not just the cfprocessing tag body. The value may be enclosed in single or double quotation marks, or none.  For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.
pageEncoding.name: pageEncoding

cfprocessingdirective.name: cfprocessingdirective

cfprocparam.help: Defines stored procedure parameters. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

help: in: The parameter is used to send data to the database system only. Passes the parameter by value. out: The parameter is used to receive data from the database system only. Passes the parameter as a bound variable. inout: The parameter is used to send and receive data. Passes the parameter as a bound variable.
type.name: type

help: CFML variable name; references the value that the output parameter has after the stored procedure is called.
variable.name: variable

help: Value that CFML passes to the stored procedure.
value.name: value

help: SQL type to which the parameter (any type) is bound. CFML supports the following values, where the last element of the name corresponds to the SQL data type. Different database systems might support different subsets of this list. See your DBMS documentation for information on supported parameter types.
cfsqltype.name: cfsqltype

help: Maximum length of a string or character IN or INOUT value attribute. A maxLength of 0 allows any length. The maxLength attribute is not required when specifying type=out.
maxlength.name: maxlength

help: Number of decimal places in numeric parameter. A scale of 0 allows any number of decimal places.
scale.name: scale

help: Whether the parameter is passed in as a null value. Not used with OUT type parameters.
null.name: null

cfprocparam.name: cfprocparam

cfprocresult.help: Associates a query object with a result set returned by a stored procedure. Other CFML tags, such as cfoutput and cftable, use this query object to access the result set. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

help: Name for the query result set.
name.name: name

help: Names one result set, if stored procedure returns more than one.
resultset.name: resultset

help: Maximum number of rows returned in result set.
maxrows.name: maxrows

cfprocresult.name: cfprocresult

cfproperty.help: Defines properties of a CFML component (CFC). Used to create complex data types for web services. The attributes of this tag are exposed as component metadata and are subject to inheritance rules.

help: Specifies the name of the property.
name.name: name

help: Specifies the ColdFusion data type for the property.
type.name: type

help: Whether the parameter is required
required.name: required

help: This sets the default value on the property when the object is created.
default.name: default

help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The value appears in parentheses following the property name.
displayname.name: displayname

help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter.
hint.name: hint

help: This attribute is used to specify the type of the property. Use this attribute to specify the following: * Primary key: Specify fieldtype = "id" to map a property to the primary key in the table. * Column: Specify the fieldtype = "column" to map a property to a column in the table. * Relationship: Specify the fieldtype = "relationship_type". The relationship_type can be one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one, or many-to-many. * Version: Specify the fieldtype="versionâ€ to indicate that the column contains versioned data. * Timestamp: Specify the fieldtype="timestamp" to indicate the column contains data with timestamp. * Collection: Specify the fieldtype="collection" to define the collection mapping.
fieldtype.name: fieldtype

help: Used to specify the data type of the primary key. If data type is not set and the ORM setting useDBForMapping=true, then the ormtype is determined by inspecting the database.
ormType.name: ormType

help: Used to specify the primary key column name.
column.name: column

help: Algorithm used to generate unique identifiers for instances of the persistent CFC.
generator.name: generator

help: Sequence key name in the database.
sequence.name: sequence

help: The column name that is used to retrieve the primary key generated by a database trigger.
selectkey.name: selectkey

help: Additional parameters required by the various generators to generate the ID. The value for the params attribute should follow the CF Struct syntax. For example: params = {key1='value1', key2='value2'}
params.name: params

help: Use this attribute to specify the length of the column. This attribute is used for table creation only.
length.name: length

help: Specifies the precision value.
precision.name: precision

help: Specifies the name of an index that is created using the mapped column
index.name: index

help: Specifies whether to generate setter methods or not
setter.name: setter

help: Specifies whether to generate getter methods or not
getter.name: getter

help: Specifies the source from where the timestamp has to be retrieved
source.name: source

help: Column name in the table that is used as value in struct.
elementcolumn.name: elementcolumn

help: Data type of the value.
elementtype.name: elementtype

help: Specifies the data type of the key, when collectiontype=struct.
structkeytype.name: structkeytype

help: The column in the target table to use as key if the collection type is struct.
structkeycolumn.name: structkeycolumn

help: Specifies the foreign key column in the Join table that references the primary key column in the target table.
inversejoincolumn.name: inversejoincolumn

help: Schema for the link table
linkschema.name: linkschema

help: Catalog for the link table
linkcatalog.name: linkcatalog

help: Name of the link table
linktable.name: linktable

help: If the value is true, and the row that is referenced by the foreign key is missing, it is treated as a null association. The default is false, in which case an exception occurs.
missingRowIgnored.name: missingRowIgnored

help: A Boolean value that specifies bidirectional association
inverse.name: inverse

help: Specifies the Order By string.
orderby.name: orderby

help: Specifies the foreign key column
fkcolumn.name: fkcolumn

help: Specifies if it is outer-join fetching or sequential select fetching
fetch.name: fetch

help: Specifies which operations should be cascaded from the parent object to the associated object
cascade.name: cascade

help: Whether a constraint is set on this table's Primary Key column to reference the Primary Key in the other table
constrained.name: constrained

help: Specifies if there should be a unique constraint on the column.
unique.name: unique

help: Groups columns in a single unique key constraint.
uniquekey.name: uniquekey

help: A Boolean value that specifies whether a notnull constriant should be added for this column.
notnull.name: notnull

help: Whether the column should be included in the SQL update statement. Set update=false and insert=false if the column needs to be read-only.
update.name: update

help: Whether the column should be included in SQL UPDATE and/or INSERT tatements. Set update=false and insert=false if the column needs to be read-only.
insert.name: insert

help: Specifies that this property value is actually generated by the database {never|always|insert} * never: Specifies that the value for this property is never generated by database * always: Specifies that the value for this property is always generated by database * insert: Specifies that the value for this property is generated at the time of insert but is not regenerated at updates.
generated.name: generated

help: SQL expression that defines the value of the property.If you specify a formula, the column value is ignored.
formula.name: formula

help: Specifies if loading is to be done by parts:
lazy.name: lazy

help: Whether updates to this property require acquisition of the optimistic lock on the table row
optimisticLock.name: optimisticLock

help: Specifies the scale value
scale.name: scale

help: Property in the target CFC that is referenced by the foreign key in the Join table.
mappedby.name: mappedby

help: Name of referenced CFC
cfc.name: cfc

help: Use this attribute to define the join column for inheritance mapping.
joinColumn.name: joinColumn

help: Takes the validator to be used for validating data when implicit setter for this property is called.
validate.name: validate

help: Takes the parameters required by the validator specified in the validate attribute. This should be specified in the implicit struct notation eg. validateparams="{min=18,max=60}">.  min: Minimum value if validate is integer/numeric/ max: Maximum value if the validate is integer/numeric/ minLength: Minimum length of the string if the validate is string minLength: Maximum length of the string if the validate is string pattern: regex expression if the validator specified in validate attribute is regex
validateParams.name: validateParams

help: Type of cache to use
cacheUse.name: cacheUse

help: Use this attribute to specify the DB-specific SQLType that should be used for the column. This attribute is used for table creation only. If this attribute is not specified, ColdFusion will automatically decide the SQLType based on the ormtype specified for this property.
sqlType.name: sqlType

help: This sets the default value of a column in the table when schema is exported.
dbDefault.name: dbDefault

help: Where condition
where.name: where

help: Specifies whether this property should be persisted. If persistent="falseâ€ all the ORM related attributes are ignored. Set this attribute to false if you do not want this property to be persisted by ORM.
persistent.name: persistent

help: An identifier property value that indicates that an instance is newly instantiated and not saved/loaded in the database
unSavedValue.name: unSavedValue

help: Specifies whether this property can be serialized. If you set this value to false, the property cannot be serialized, so any changes made are not retained on session replication, and the property has its default value (if any) on the second server. Use this attribute to prevent serializaton of properties in CFCs that are serializable.
serializable.name: serializable

help: Use this prperty to define the custom name for generated relationship methods. Applies to one-to-many and  many-to-many
singularname.name: singularname

help: If remotingFetch is false, then the value of that attribute is not sent over flash remoting. remotingFetch is true by default was all properties. But in case of cfcs for which persistent = true, the value of the remotingFetch attribute is false by default for any property that shares one-to-one, one-to-many, many-to-one or many-to-many relationship.
remotingFetch.name: remotingFetch

help: Table name
table.name: table

help: Used to prioritize the search results. Higher the boost, more the priority. Default is 1.
indexBoost.name: indexBoost

help: If true, marks the column for indexing. Except in the case of PK and compositekey (which are indexed if any of the non-PK property is set to indexed), the default value is false
indexTokenize.name: indexTokenize

help: true: Stores the value in the original form, without tokenizing. false: Does not store the value. compressed: Stores the original value in a compressed form, based on Lucene implementation
indexStore.name: indexStore

help: Specifies the field name that is used in search query while indexing and performing search
indexFieldName.name: indexFieldName

help: If true, marks the column for indexing. Except in the case of PK and compositekey (which are indexed if any of the non-PK property is set to indexed), the default value is false
indexable.name: indexable

help: Specify the language that is used to index and search. The value overrides the value defined in cfcomponent and the Application.cfc
indexLanguage.name: indexLanguage

cfproperty.name: cfproperty

cfquery.help: Passes queries or SQL statements to a data source. It is recommended that you use the cfqueryparam tag within every cfquery tag, to help secure your databases from unauthorized users

help: Name of query. Used in page to reference query record set. Must begin with a letter. Can include letters, numbers, and underscores.
name.name: name

help: Name of data source from which query gets data.
datasource.name: datasource

help: A struct that takes orm options for executing HQL. Applies only if dbtype is set to hql.
ormoptions.name: ormoptions

help: query. Use this value to specify the results of a query as input.
dbtype.name: dbtype

help: Overrides username in data source setup.
username.name: username

help: Overrides password in data source setup.
password.name: password

help: Maximum number of rows to return in record set. -1 returns all records.
maxrows.name: maxrows

help: Maximum rows to get at a time from server. Range: 1 - 100. Might not be supported by some database systems.
blockfactor.name: blockfactor

help: Maximum number of seconds that each action of a query is permitted to execute before returning an error. The cumulative time may exceed this value.  For JDBC statements, CFML sets this attribute. For other drivers, check driver documentation.
timeout.name: timeout

help: Date value (for example, April 16, 1999, 4-16-99). If date of original query is after this date, CFML uses cached query data. To use cached data, current query must use same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, password.  A date/time object is in the range 100 AD-9999 AD.  When specifying a date value as a string, you must enclose it in quotation marks.
cachedafter.name: cachedafter

help: Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original query date falls within the time span, cached query data is used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present, back. Takes effect only if query caching is enabled in the Administrator.  To use cached data, the current query must use the same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, and password.
cachedwithin.name: cachedwithin

help: Yes: If debugging is enabled, but the Administrator Database Activity option is not enabled, displays SQL submitted to datasource and number of records returned by query. No: If the Administrator Database Activity option is enabled, suppresses display.
debug.name: debug

help: Specifies a name for the structure in which cfquery returns the result variables. * SQL: The SQL statement that was executed. (string) * Cached: If the query was cached. (boolean) * SqlParameters: An ordered Array of cfqueryparam values. (array) * RecordCount: Total number of records in the query. (numeric) * ColumnList: Column list, comma seperated. (numeric) * ExecutionTime: Execution time for the SQL request. (numeric)
result.name: result

help: Id with which query result should be stored in cache.
cacheId.name: cacheId

help: Name of cache region in which query result should be stored.
cacheRegion.name: cacheRegion

help: Flag to indicate if clientinfo properties should be added to the result variable
fetchclientinfo.name: fetchclientinfo

help: Contains clientinfo properties to be set on the database connection
clientinfo.name: clientinfo

cfquery.name: cfquery

cfqueryparam.help: Verifies the data type of a query parameter and, for DBMSs that support bind variables, enables CFML to use bind variables in the SQL statement. Bind variable usage enhances performance when executing a cfquery statement multiple times.  This tag is nested within a cfquery tag, embedded in a query SQL statement. If you specify optional parameters, this tag performs data validation.

help: Value that CFML passes to the right of the comparison operator in a where clause.  If CFSQLType is a date or time option, ensure that the date value uses your DBMS-specific date format. Use the CreateODBCDateTime or DateFormat and TimeFormat functions to format the date value.
value.name: value

help: SQL type that parameter (any type) is bound to.
cfsqltype.name: cfsqltype

help: Maximum length of parameter.
maxlength.name: maxlength

help: Number of decimal places in parameter. Applies to CF_SQL_NUMERIC and CF_SQL_DECIMAL.
scale.name: scale

help: Whether parameter is passed as a null value.  Yes: tag ignores the value attribute No: does not
null.name: null

help: Yes: The value attribute value is a delimited list No: it is not
list.name: list

help: Character that separates values in list, in value attribute.
separator.name: separator

cfqueryparam.name: cfqueryparam

cfregistry.help: Reads, writes, and deletes keys and values in the system registry. Provides persistent storage of client variables. This tag is deprecated for the UNIX platform. Note: For this tag to execute, it must be enabled in the ColdFusion MX Administrator.

help: Action to perform
action.name: action

help: Name of a registry branch.
branch.name: branch

help: Registry value to access. Note: For key deletion this attribute is required.
entry.name: entry

help: Variable into which to put value.
variable.name: variable

help: * string: returns string values. * dWord: returns DWord values. * key: returns keys. * any: returns keys and values.
type.name: type

help: Sorts query column data (case-insensitive). Sorts on Entry, Type, and Value columns as text. Specify a combination of columns from query output, in a comma-delimited list. For example: sort = "value desc, entry asc" * asc: ascending (a to z) sort order. * desc: descending (z to a) sort order.
sort.name: sort

help: Absolute pathname of directory against which to perform action.
directory.name: directory

help: Name for output record set.
name.name: name

help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.
mode.name: mode

help: New name for directory.
newdirectory.name: newdirectory

help: Value data to set. If you omit this attribute, the cfregistry tag creates default value, as follows: * string: creates an empty string: "". * dWord: creates a value of 0 (zero).
value.name: value

help: Whether ColdFusion performs the action on subdirectories.
recurse.name: recurse

help: No Help Available
registryversion.name: registryversion

cfregistry.name: cfregistry

cfreport.help: Used to do either of the following: - Execute a report definition created with the ColdFusion Report Builder, displaying it in PDF, FlashPaper, or Excel format. You can optionally save this report to a file. - Run a predefined Crystal Reports report. Applies only to Windows systems. Uses the CFCRYSTAL.exe file to generate reports. Sets parameters in the Crystal Reports engine according to its attribute values.

help: Specifies the path to the report definition file, relative to the web root.
template.name: template

help: Specifies the output format.
format.name: format

help: The name of the ColdFusion variable that will hold the report output. You cannot specify both name and filename.
name.name: name

help: The filename to contain the report. You cannot specify both name and filename.
filename.name: filename

help: The name of the query that contains input data for the report. If you omit this parameter, the report definition obtains data from the internal SQL or from cfreportparam items.
query.name: query

help: Specifies whether to overwrite files that have the same name as that specified in the filename attribute. Default: false
overwrite.name: overwrite

help: Specifies whether the output is encrypted. PDF format only. Default: none
encryption.name: encryption

help: Specifies an owner password. PDF format only.
ownerpassword.name: ownerpassword

help: Specifies a user password. PDF format only.
userpassword.name: userpassword

help: Specifies one or more permissions. PDF format only. Separate multiple permissions with a comma.
permissions.name: permissions

help: Name of registered or native data source.
datasource.name: datasource

help: * standard (not valid for Crystal Reports 8.0) * netscape * microsoft
type.name: type

help: Maximum time, in seconds, in which a connection must be made to a Crystal Report.
timeout.name: timeout

help: Report path. Store Crystal Reports files in the same directories as CFML page files.
report.name: report

help: Orders results according to your specifications.
orderby.name: orderby

help: Username required for entry into database from which report is created. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.
username.name: username

help: Password that corresponds to username required for database access. Overrides default settings for data source in CFML Administrator.
password.name: password

help: One or more named formulas. Terminate each formula with a semicolon. Use the format:  formula = "formulaname1='formula1';formulaname2='formula2';"  If you use a semicolon in a formula, you must escape it by typing it twice (;;). For example:  formula = "Name1 = 'Val_1a;;Val_1b';Name2 = 'Val2';"
formula.name: formula

help: Life span of the resource directory. Used only with format=HTML
resourceTimespan.name: resourceTimespan

help: Style in CSS format that overrides a style defined in the Report Builder report at run time.
style.name: style

cfreport.name: cfreport

cfreportparam.help: Passes input parameters to a ColdFusion Report Builder report definition. Allowed inside cfreport tag bodies only.

help: Variable name for data that is passed. The ColdFusion Report Builder report definition must include an input parameter that matches this name.
name.name: name

help: Value of the data that is sent.
value.name: value

help: Name of the chart contained in a report or subreport. The value of this attribute must match Name property of a chart defined in the Report Builder report.
chart.name: chart

help: Query value to pass to a subreport or chart. The ColdFusion query must contain at least all of the columns included in the Report Builder query.
query.name: query

help: Ordinal number of a chart series to use for the query. This attribute is valid only when the chart attribute is specified.
series.name: series

help: Style in CSS format for a subreport.
style.name: style

help: Name of the subreport.
subreport.name: subreport

cfreportparam.name: cfreportparam

cfrethrow.help: Rethrows the currently active exception. Preserves the exception's cfcatch.type and cfcatch.tagContext variable values.
cfrethrow.name: cfrethrow

cfreturn.help: Returns result values from a component method. Contains an expression returned as result of the function. An expression; the result of the function from which this tag is called.
cfreturn.name: cfreturn

cfsavecontent.help: Saves the generated content of the cfsavecontent tag, including the results of evaluating expressions and executing custom tags, in the specified variable.

help: Name ofthe variable in which to save the generated content of the tag.
variable.name: variable

cfsavecontent.name: cfsavecontent

cfschedule.help: Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is performed to populate the page.

help: delete: Deletes the specified task update: Updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist run: Executes the specified task pause : If only groupname is specified all tasks of the group will be paused resume: If only groupname is specified all tasks of the group will be resumed list : Lists all the scheduled tasks pauseall : Pauses all scheduled tasks for a particular application resumeall : Resumes all scheduled tasks for a particular application
action.name: action

help: Name of the task.
task.name: task

help: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.
operation.name: operation

help: Name of the file in which to store the published output of the scheuled task
file.name: file

help: Path to the directory in which to put the published file.
path.name: path

help: Date on which to first run the scheuled task.
startdate.name: startdate

help: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.
starttime.name: starttime

help: URL of the page to execute.
URL.name: URL

help: Port to use on the server that is specified by the url parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value.
port.name: port

help: Yes: save the result to a file No: does not
publish.name: publish

help: Date when scheduled task ends.
endDate.name: endDate

help: Time when scheduled task ends (seconds).
endTime.name: endTime

help: Interval at which task is scheduled. * number of seconds (minimum is 60) * once * daily * weekly * monthly
interval.name: interval

help: Can be used to extend the default timeout period.
requesttimeout.name: requesttimeout

help: Username, if URL is protected.
username.name: username

help: Password, if URL is protected.
password.name: password

help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.
proxyserver.name: proxyserver

help: Port number to use on the proxy server.
proxyport.name: proxyport

help: User name to provide to the proxy server.
proxyuser.name: proxyuser

help: Password to provide to the proxy server.
proxypassword.name: proxypassword

help: Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute references No: does not
resolveurl.name: resolveurl

help: The name of the group for the given task
group.name: group

help: Action to be taken if the task throws an exception
onException.name: onException

help: Number of times the given task should be repeated
repeat.name: repeat

help: Names of the tasks to be executed once this task is done
onComplete.name: onComplete

help: Time at which the task is to be executed, in cron job syntax
cronTime.name: cronTime

help: Priority of the task. Default is 5.
priority.name: priority

help: A cfc file whose pre-defined methods will be invoked for various events while running the task
eventHandler.name: eventHandler

help: Comma separated dates or date range which should be excluded from scheduling period
exclude.name: exclude

help: Decides whether the given task to be executed in cluster setup
cluster.name: cluster

help: Action to be taken if the task could not be executed at the scheduled time
onMisfire.name: onMisfire

help: How many times to continue re-firing in case job execution throws an exception
retrycount.name: retrycount

help: If it is server specific or application specific task
mode.name: mode

help: Name of the result variable
result.name: result

help: Flag to indicate if log files should be overwritten when scheduled task executes
overwrite.name: overwrite

cfschedule.name: cfschedule

cfscript.help: Encloses a code block that contains cfscript statements.  You cannot use some CFML reserved words in this tag. You cannot put a user-defined function whose name begins with any of these strings within this tag: cf,cf_,_cf,CFML,CFML_,_CFML
cfscript.name: cfscript

cfsearch.help: Searches Solr collections (CFML can also search collections that have not been registered, with the cfcollection tag.)  A collection must be created and indexed before this tag can return search results.

help: Name of the search query.
name.name: name

help: One or more collection names. You can specify more than one collection unless you are performing a category search (that is, specifying category or categoryTree).  One or more collection names. You can specify more than one collection unless you are performing a category search (that is, specifying category or categoryTree).
collection.name: collection

help: A list of categories, separated by commas, to which the search is limited. If specified, and the collection does not have categories enabled, ColdFusion  throws an exception.
category.name: category

help: The location in a hierarchical category tree at which to start the search. ColdFusion searches at and below this level. If specified, and the collection does not have categories enabled, ColdFusion throws an exception. Can be used in addition to category attribute.
categorytree.name: categorytree

help: Specifies the name of the structure variable into which ColdFusion places search information, including alternative criteria suggestions (spelling corrections).
status.name: status

help: Used to specify the parser that SOLR uses to process the criteria.
type.name: type

help: Search criteria. Follows the syntax rules of the type attribute. If you pass a mixed-case entry in this attribute, the search is case-sensitive. If you pass all uppercase or all lowercase, the search is case-insensitive.
criteria.name: criteria

help: Maximum number of rows to return in query results. Default: all
maxrows.name: maxrows

help: First row number to get. Default: 1
startrow.name: startrow

help: Specifies whether SOLR returns spelling suggestions for possibly misspelled words.
suggestions.name: suggestions

help: The number of passages/sentences Solr returns in the context summary (that is, the context column of the results). Default: 3
contextPassages.name: contextPassages

help: The maximum number of bytes Solr returns in the context summary. Default: 300
contextBytes.name: contextBytes

help: The HTML to prepend to search terms in the context summary. Use this attribute in conjunction with contextHighlightEnd to highlight search terms in the context summary. Default:
contextHighlightBegin.name: contextHighlightBegin

help: The HTML to prepend to search terms in the context summary. Use this attribute in conjunction with contextHighlightEnd to highlight search terms in the context summary. Default:
contextHighlightEnd.name: contextHighlightEnd

help: The name of a result set from an existing set of search results. Solr searches the result set for criteria without regard to the previous search score or rank. Use this attribute to implement searching within result sets.
previousCriteria.name: previousCriteria

help: Name of column(s), search result ahould be sorted by
orderBy.name: orderBy

help: Specify column names in the search result
searchcolumns.name: searchcolumns

help: Timeout value for the search operation
searchtime.name: searchtime

cfsearch.name: cfsearch

cfselect.help: Constructs a drop-down list box form control. Used within a cfform tag.  You can populate the list from a query, or by using the HTML option tag.

help: Name of the select form element
name.name: name

help: ID for form input element.
id.name: id

help: A bind expression that dynamically sets an attribute of the control.
bind.name: bind

help: Specifies the HTML tag attribute whose value is set by the bind attribute. You can only specify attributes in the browserâ€™s HTML DOM tree, not ColdFusion- specific attributes. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.
bindAttribute.name: bindAttribute

help: A Boolean value that specifies whether to execute the bind attribute expression when first loading the form. Ignored if there is no bind attribute.
bindOnLoad.name: bindOnLoad

help: Boolean value specifying whether you can edit the contents of the control.
editable.name: editable

help: Label to put next to the control on a Flash or XML-format form.
label.name: label

help: In HTML or XML format forms, ColdFusion passes the style attribute to the browser or XML. In Flash format, must be a style specification in CSS format, with the same syntax and contents as used in Macromedia Flex for the corresponding Flash element. Post alpha we will document specifics.
style.name: style

help: The URL of a page to display as a tool tip. The page can include CFML and HTML markup to control the tip contents and format, and the tip can include images. If you specify this attribute, an animated icon appears with the text "Loading..." while the tip is being loaded.
sourceForTooltip.name: sourceForTooltip

help: Number of entries to display at one time. The default, 1, displays a drop-down list. Any other value displays a list box with size number of entries visible at one time.
size.name: size

help: If true a list element must be selected when form is submitted. Note: This attribute has no effect if you omit the size attribute or set it to 1 because the browser always submits the displayed item. You can work around this issue format forms by having an initial option tag with value=" " (note the space character between the quotation marks). Default: false
required.name: required

help: Message to display if required="true" and no selection is made.
message.name: message

help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.
onerror.name: onerror

help: - true: allow selecting multiple elements in drop-down list - false: don't allow selecting multiple elements Default: false
multiple.name: multiple

help: Name of query to populate drop-down list.
query.name: query

help: Query column to use for the value of each list element. Used with query attribute.
value.name: value

help: Query column to use for the display label of each list element. Used with query attribute.
display.name: display

help: Query column to use to group the items in the drop-down list into a two-level hierarchical list..
group.name: group

help: If you populate the options list with a query and use HTML option child tags to specify additional entries, determines the location of the items from the query relative to the items from the option tags: - above: Put the query items above the options items. - below: Put the query items below the options items. Default: above
queryposition.name: queryposition

help: One or more option values to preselect in the selection list. To specify multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. This attribute applies only if selection list items are generated from a query. The cfform preservedata attribute value can override this value.
selected.name: selected

help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a keyboard key in the control.
onkeyup.name: onkeyup

help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) ActionScript to run when the user depresses a keyboard key in the control.
onkeydown.name: onkeydown

help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user presses a mouse button in the control.
onmouseup.name: onmouseup

help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the user releases a mouse button in the control.
onmousedown.name: onmousedown

help: JavaScript (HTML/XML) or ActionScript (Flash) to run when the control changes due to user action.
onchange.name: onchange

help: JavaScript to run when the user clicks the control.
onclick.name: onclick

help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
enabled.name: enabled

help: Flash only: Boolean value specifying whether to show the control. Space that would be occupied by an invisible control is blank. Default: true
visible.name: visible

help: Flash only: Text to display when the mouse pointer hovers over the control.
tooltip.name: tooltip

help: The height of the control, in pixels.
height.name: height

help: The width of the control, in pixels.
width.name: width

help: The name of a JavaScript function to execute if evaluating a bind expression results in an error. The function must take two attributes: an HTTP status code and a message.
onbinderror.name: onbinderror

cfselect.name: cfselect

cfset.help: Sets a value in CFML. Used to create a variable, if it does not exist, and assign it a value. Also used to call functions.
cfset.name: cfset

cfsetting.help: Controls aspects of page processing, such as the output of HTML code in pages.

help: Yes: blocks output of HTML that is outside cfoutput tags No: displays HTML that is outside cfoutput tags.
enablecfoutputonly.name: enablecfoutputonly

help: Yes: If debugging is enabled in the Administrator, displays debugging information No: suppresses debugging information that would otherwise display at end of generated page.
showdebugoutput.name: showdebugoutput

help: Integer; number of seconds. Time limit, after which CFML processes the page as an unresponsive thread. Overrides the timeout set in the CFML Administrator.
requesttimeout.name: requesttimeout
